benchmark_details.name: CKAD (Cost-effective Knowledge Acquisition Dataset)
benchmark_details.overview: CKAD is a new benchmark dataset designed for cost-effective LLM domain knowledge acquisition, aiming to enhance the performance of large language models in specialized domains, particularly drug discovery and rare disease research.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the CKAD dataset is to facilitate the enhancement of domain-specific large language models through efficient and cost-effective expert engagement.

data.source: Constructed from PubMed articles published after 2023, extracting question-answer pairs using GPT-4 based on unique mechanisms.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the percentage of instances where model-generated answers adequately capture the core meaning of the golden answer and account for answer length discrepancies.
methodology.interpretation: Higher WR and LC_WR indicate better performance and knowledge acquisition from the dataset.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparison with existing methods shows PU-ADKA outperforming all baselines in both WR and LC_WR.
methodology.validation: Performance validated through simulations and a real-world case study with biomedical experts.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All content derived from publicly available biomedical literature; no personal or sensitive information collected.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: All expert annotations performed as part of their institutional responsibilities without additional compensation.
